<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Provides a resource to creating dedicated tunnels instances.

> **NOTE:** 1. ID of the DC is queried, can only apply for this resource offline.

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as tencentcloud from "@tencentcloud_iac/pulumi";

const config = new pulumi.Config();
const dcId = config.get("dcId") || "dc-kax48sg7";
const dcgId = config.get("dcgId") || "dcg-dmbhf7jf";
const vpcId = config.get("vpcId") || "vpc-4h9v4mo3";
const bgpMain = new tencentcloud.dcx.Instance("bgpMain", {
    bandwidth: 900,
    dcId: dcId,
    dcgId: dcgId,
    networkType: "VPC",
    routeType: "BGP",
    vlan: 306,
    vpcId: vpcId,
});
const staticMain = new tencentcloud.dcx.Instance("staticMain", {
    bandwidth: 900,
    dcId: dcId,
    dcgId: dcgId,
    dcOwnerAccount: "xxxxxxxx",
    networkType: "VPC",
    routeType: "STATIC",
    vlan: 301,
    vpcId: vpcId,
    routeFilterPrefixes: ["10.10.10.101/32"],
    tencentAddress: "100.93.46.1/30",
    customerAddress: "100.93.46.2/30",
});
```
```python
import pulumi
import tencentcloud_iac_pulumi as tencentcloud

config = pulumi.Config()
dc_id = config.get("dcId")
if dc_id is None:
    dc_id = "dc-kax48sg7"
dcg_id = config.get("dcgId")
if dcg_id is None:
    dcg_id = "dcg-dmbhf7jf"
vpc_id = config.get("vpcId")
if vpc_id is None:
    vpc_id = "vpc-4h9v4mo3"
bgp_main = tencentcloud.dcx.Instance("bgpMain",
    bandwidth=900,
    dc_id=dc_id,
    dcg_id=dcg_id,
    network_type="VPC",
    route_type="BGP",
    vlan=306,
    vpc_id=vpc_id)
static_main = tencentcloud.dcx.Instance("staticMain",
    bandwidth=900,
    dc_id=dc_id,
    dcg_id=dcg_id,
    dc_owner_account="xxxxxxxx",
    network_type="VPC",
    route_type="STATIC",
    vlan=301,
    vpc_id=vpc_id,
    route_filter_prefixes=["10.10.10.101/32"],
    tencent_address="100.93.46.1/30",
    customer_address="100.93.46.2/30")
```

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi/config"
	"github.com/tencentcloudstack/pulumi-tencentcloud/sdk/go/tencentcloud/Dcx"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		cfg := config.New(ctx, "")
		dcId := "dc-kax48sg7"
		if param := cfg.Get("dcId"); param != "" {
			dcId = param
		}
		dcgId := "dcg-dmbhf7jf"
		if param := cfg.Get("dcgId"); param != "" {
			dcgId = param
		}
		vpcId := "vpc-4h9v4mo3"
		if param := cfg.Get("vpcId"); param != "" {
			vpcId = param
		}
		_, err := Dcx.NewInstance(ctx, "bgpMain", &Dcx.InstanceArgs{
			Bandwidth:   pulumi.Int(900),
			DcId:        pulumi.String(dcId),
			DcgId:       pulumi.String(dcgId),
			NetworkType: pulumi.String("VPC"),
			RouteType:   pulumi.String("BGP"),
			Vlan:        pulumi.Int(306),
			VpcId:       pulumi.String(vpcId),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		_, err = Dcx.NewInstance(ctx, "staticMain", &Dcx.InstanceArgs{
			Bandwidth:      pulumi.Int(900),
			DcId:           pulumi.String(dcId),
			DcgId:          pulumi.String(dcgId),
			DcOwnerAccount: pulumi.String("xxxxxxxx"),
			NetworkType:    pulumi.String("VPC"),
			RouteType:      pulumi.String("STATIC"),
			Vlan:           pulumi.Int(301),
			VpcId:          pulumi.String(vpcId),
			RouteFilterPrefixes: pulumi.StringArray{
				pulumi.String("10.10.10.101/32"),
			},
			TencentAddress:  pulumi.String("100.93.46.1/30"),
			CustomerAddress: pulumi.String("100.93.46.2/30"),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```
```java
package generated_program;

import com.pulumi.Context;
import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
import com.pulumi.core.Output;
import com.pulumi.tencentcloud.Dcx.Instance;
import com.pulumi.tencentcloud.Dcx.InstanceArgs;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Map;
import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        final var config = ctx.config();
        final var dcId = config.get("dcId").orElse("dc-kax48sg7");
        final var dcgId = config.get("dcgId").orElse("dcg-dmbhf7jf");
        final var vpcId = config.get("vpcId").orElse("vpc-4h9v4mo3");
        var bgpMain = new Instance("bgpMain", InstanceArgs.builder()        
            .bandwidth(900)
            .dcId(dcId)
            .dcgId(dcgId)
            .networkType("VPC")
            .routeType("BGP")
            .vlan(306)
            .vpcId(vpcId)
            .build());

        var staticMain = new Instance("staticMain", InstanceArgs.builder()        
            .bandwidth(900)
            .dcId(dcId)
            .dcgId(dcgId)
            .dcOwnerAccount("xxxxxxxx")
            .networkType("VPC")
            .routeType("STATIC")
            .vlan(301)
            .vpcId(vpcId)
            .routeFilterPrefixes("10.10.10.101/32")
            .tencentAddress("100.93.46.1/30")
            .customerAddress("100.93.46.2/30")
            .build());

    }
}
```

```yaml
  dcgId:
    type: string
    default: dcg-dmbhf7jf
  vpcId:

    default: vpc-4h9v4mo3

  bgpMain:
    type: tencentcloud:Dcx:Instance
    properties:
      bandwidth: 900
      dcId: ${dcId}
      dcgId: ${dcgId}
      networkType: VPC
      routeType: BGP
      vlan: 306
      vpcId: ${vpcId}
  staticMain:

    properties:
      bandwidth: 900
      dcId: ${dcId}
      dcgId: ${dcgId}
      dcOwnerAccount: xxxxxxxx
      networkType: VPC
      routeType: STATIC
```

## Instance Resource Properties {#properties}

To learn more about resource properties and how to use them, see [Inputs and Outputs](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) in the Architecture and Concepts docs.

### Inputs

The Instance resource accepts the following [input](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) properties:

        <span class="property-type">string</span>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#routefilterprefixes_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">route<wbr>Filter<wbr>Prefixes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Static route, the network address of the user IDC. It can be modified after setting but cannot be deleted. AN unable field within BGP.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="routetype_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#routetype_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">route<wbr>Type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Type of the route, and available values include BGP and STATIC. The default value is <code>BGP</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="tencentaddress_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#tencentaddress_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tencent<wbr>Address</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Interconnect IP of the DC within Tencent.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="vlan_nodejs">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Vlan of the dedicated tunnels. Valid value ranges: (0~3000). <code>0</code> means that only one tunnel can be created for the physical connect.</p>

### Outputs

All [input](#inputs) properties are implicitly available as output properties. Additionally, the Instance resource produces the following output properties:



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="createtime_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Creation time of resource.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="id_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">

</span>

        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>State of the dedicated tunnels. Valid value: <code>PENDING</code>, <code>ALLOCATING</code>, <code>ALLOCATED</code>, <code>ALTERING</code>, <code>DELETING</code>, <code>DELETED</code>, <code>COMFIRMING</code> and <code>REJECTED</code>.</p>

</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>State of the dedicated tunnels. Valid value: <code>PENDING</code>, <code>ALLOCATING</code>, <code>ALLOCATED</code>, <code>ALTERING</code>, <code>DELETING</code>, <code>DELETED</code>, <code>COMFIRMING</code> and <code>REJECTED</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

## Look up Existing Instance Resource {#look-up}

Get an existing Instance resource's state with the given name, ID, and optional extra properties used to qualify the lookup.
<div>
<pulumi-chooser type="language" options="typescript,python,go,csharp,java,yaml"></pulumi-chooser>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>

        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

    </dt>
    <dd><p>Bandwidth of the DC.</p>

        <span id="state_create_time_python">

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_name_python">

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_route_filter_prefixes_python">

    <dd><p>Static route, the network address of the user IDC. It can be modified after setting but cannot be deleted. AN unable field within BGP.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_route_type_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_route_type_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">route_<wbr>type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Type of the route, and available values include BGP and STATIC. The default value is <code>BGP</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_state_python">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>State of the dedicated tunnels. Valid value: <code>PENDING</code>, <code>ALLOCATING</code>, <code>ALLOCATED</code>, <code>ALTERING</code>, <code>DELETING</code>, <code>DELETED</code>, <code>COMFIRMING</code> and <code>REJECTED</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tencent_address_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tencent_address_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tencent_<wbr>address</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Interconnect IP of the DC within Tencent.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_vlan_python">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Vlan of the dedicated tunnels. Valid value ranges: (0~3000). <code>0</code> means that only one tunnel can be created for the physical connect.</p>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_vpc_id_python">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>

</dd></dl>

## Import



DCX instance can be imported using the id, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import tencentcloud:Dcx/instance:Instance foo dcx-cbbr1gjk
```
